title: Quantum Teleportation of Photonic Polarization States
description: Teleports an unknown quantum polarization state from Alice to Bob using entangled photon pairs, Bell state measurement, and classical communication

parameters.description: Electronic unit processing Alice's 4 SPAD outputs to identify two-photon coincidence events within 1ns window and determine Bell state measurement outcome. Electrically connected to detectors D1-D4 via coaxial cables. Outputs 2-bit classical result to Classical Channel unit.
parameters.input_connections: Alice D1, D2, D3, D4 via BNC cables

parameters.description: Classical communication link transmitting Alice's Bell measurement result (2 bits) to Bob's station via RF or fiber link, triggering voltage control signals to Pockels cells for unitary correction. Receives input from Coincidence Counter and outputs control voltages to Bob Bit-Flip Gate and Bob Phase-Flip Gate.
parameters.output_connections: Bob Pockels cells via high-voltage drivers

physics_explanation: Type-I SPDC generates entangled photon pairs in Bell state |Φ+⟩ = (|HH⟩ + |VV⟩)/√2, with one photon sent to Alice and one to Bob. Alice prepares unknown state |ψ⟩ = α|H⟩ + β|V⟩ and performs Bell state measurement by interfering it with her entangled photon at a 50:50 non-polarizing beam splitter (enabling Hong-Ou-Mandel interference), followed by polarization analysis with two PBSs and four detectors. The two-photon coincidence pattern projects onto one of four Bell states, collapsing Bob's photon into a state related to |ψ⟩ by a known Pauli operator. Electronic coincidence logic identifies the Bell state and transmits classical bits via RF/fiber to Bob's station, triggering Pockels cells to apply the appropriate correction (identity, σ_x, σ_z, or σ_xσ_z), recovering the exact original state.
expected_outcome: When Alice's coincidence counter registers a two-photon detection event (e.g., D1 and D3 fire simultaneously within 1ns), the Bell state is projected and Bob's photon collapses to a specific state. The Coincidence Counter identifies the Bell state from the detector pattern: (D1,D3)→|Φ+⟩, (D1,D4)→|Φ-⟩, (D2,D3)→|Ψ+⟩, (D2,D4)→|Ψ-⟩. The Classical Channel transmits this result electronically to Bob's station and triggers appropriate Pockels cell voltages: (D1,D3)→identity (no correction), (D1,D4)→σ_z (phase flip), (D2,D3)→σ_x (bit flip), (D2,D4)→σ_xσ_z (both flips). After correction, Bob's detectors measure the teleported state with fidelity >85-90%, confirming successful transfer of the quantum state |+⟩ = (|H⟩ + |V⟩)/√2. Quantum state tomography over multiple runs verifies the teleported state matches the original, while the no-cloning theorem is preserved since Alice's photon is destroyed in the Bell measurement. The experiment demonstrates genuine quantum teleportation with classical communication completing the protocol.
note: Component numbers match the labels shown in 07_optical_setup.png (1-indexed)
